author: BobaFett2
title: Like all Junior sets, it's not great. Just good
review:
I don't know why I have so many Junior sets. Probably gifts. This is the only one I really like, because it has some parts which are very, very useful.

Parts

There are a lot of useful parts in this set, which is why I gave it it's rating. The best parts are the trailer, (very useful), two parts which go well with Alpha Team-Mission Deep Sea, the exhaust pipe, the bumper, the chain, and the wheels. Otherwise, there's not much to it.

Building and Playing

Not much to say. It's very playable, like all 4 Juniors sets but it's not very good. Building is so easy I could do it with my feet and one eye closed.

Overall

Pros

  • Some nice parts

Cons

  • It's way too expensive for the number of parts
  • Why don't they have normal minifigures?
  • Juniorized to the max
Again, unless you are building a juniorized town, probably not worth it.

author: modena
title: Very basic, but (obviously) easy to rebuild
review:
This was a great little set when I was small. I still use it dues to its stability and to its ability to rebuild.

Pros:

  • Good colours!
  • Easy to rebuild!
  • Rare chain part!
  • Strong/Stable construction!

Cons:

Very simple minifigures.
Too easy to build!

Overall:

This wasn't a good set, nor a bad set. Obviously it is so easy to build, but this gives it the ability to rebuild easily into something else. There are some rare parts/parts that I really like in this set, like the silver-coloured exhaust pipes.

Overall, this is a nice and stable set, but don't get it if you want to make a hard-to-build collection!
